N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 1003.5 - Extension of prompt payment date

State Regulations

The date by which a proper invoice may be paid without the
accruing of interest may be extended beyond the payment date specified in
subdivision (b) of section
1003.4
of this Part when any of
the following facts or conditions exists: (a) in accordance with specific statutory or
contractual provisions, payment must be preceded by: (1)
an inspection period; (2)
the receipt of a signed report in the
case of the purchase of goods for an entity other than the Fund; or
(3)
an audit to determine the resources
applied or used by a contractor in fulfilling the terms of the
contract; (b) the
necessary State appropriation required to authorize payment has not been
enacted; (c) a proper invoice must
be examined by the federal government prior to payment; or
(d) the date by which payment must be made is
modified in accordance with section
1003.7
of this Part. Notes
